name: The BB Necklace - available for pre-order
description:
Coming Soon...

The BB Necklace

Fondly named after my Grandmother Betty, or as her friends called her "BB". 

Each BARBER X COAD Collection piece is cast in reclaimed sterling silver or bronze and designed using original watch fobs, costume jewelry, antique coins & war medallions found in family collections dating from the 1800s as inspiration. Each piece is hand carved, hand cast & hand crafted in our studio in Vancouver, Canada.


- The idea of dialectics has in many ways served as the foundational idea for BARBER/COAD. Not only is this collection a symbolic representation of this synthesis between opposition, but inspiration is also consciously being drawn from the convergent sides of my own familial heritage.  Barber and Coad are respectively the maiden names of each of my Grandmothers – two women who have been crucial in determining my identity as a woman and designer. In many ways, I view myself as a synthesis, the intersecting point of two infinitely outstretching familial lines, each fatefully converging to ignite my creative inclinations. -

> Each piece is made to order, please anticipate 1-3 weeks shipping time
____________________________________
Copyright: Designs, Photos, Text 2013 JEX, LLC

description:
Coming Soon...

The IDA Ring

Fondly named after my Great Grandmother Ida Bell, a Metis woman who's brave history spans the Great Plains of Canada from Manitoba to Alberta following the likes of Louis Riel.


Each BARBER X COAD Collection piece is cast in reclaimed sterling silver or bronze and designed using original watch fobs, costume jewelry, antique coins & war medallions found in family collections dating from the 1800s as inspiration. categories.name: S T I C K S /S T O N ES
B A R B E R / C O A D

name: P H O E N I X Necklace
description:
>The PHOENIX Necklace is part of our limited edition
S P A C E / T I M E Collection

> In Greek mythology, a phoenix is a long-lived bird that is cyclically regenerated or reborn. Associated with the sun, a phoenix obtains new life by arising from the ashes of its predecessor. 

>An absolutely stunning statement piece; the PHOENIX Necklace much like its name has obtained new life in re-purposed bronze, is strung upon antique double linked chains and mimics the bursting rays of a brilliant rising sun.

> Each piece is conceived using the lost wax method of casting. Sketches are translated into carved wax & then cast into a final metal form that I hand finish and detail at my studio in Vancouver, BC.

SPACE / TIME - With shapes influenced by organic, microscopic & macroscopic forms. This collection, both hard and soft, has palettes informed by the Northern Lights, the disphotic zone of the ocean & the far reaches of the universe. Sacred geometry found in nature, telescopic satellite imagery and ancient artifacts are also referenced in the collection. -

> Each piece is made to order, please anticipate 1-3 weeks shipping time
____________________________________
Copyright: Designs, Photos, Text 2013 JEX, LLC

categories.name: S P A C E / T I M E

name: O R I O N NECKLACE
description:
The O R I O N Necklace is part of our limited edition Space/Time Collection

> Inspired by celestial imagery found in books from childhoods past,
this piece is first roughly sketched on paper before being translated into carved wax and then cast into a final metal form before being finished by the artist. 

>Solid Bronze piece on one-of-a-kind brass deadstock chain from the 50's found at a closed factory in Toronto.

- With shapes influenced by organic, microscopic & macroscopic forms. Sacred geometry found in nature, telescopic satellite imagery and ancient artifacts are also referenced in the collection. -

categories.name: S P A C E / T I M E

name: D E V I Stone Stacking Ring
description:
The D E V I Stone Stacking Ring is part of our 
ROAM / REMAIN Collection

> The design of this ring is inspired by antique Tibetan heirlooms found on our travels through Darjeeling & Gangtok, East Sikkim. Coral and turquoise held significant meaning for the ancient Tibetans.  
- Turquoise represented the circle of life, this may be attributed to the fact that when turquoise has not been treated, it often changes color
- Corals auspicious red color made it highly esteemed as a good luck charm and protection from calamities and the 'evil eye'.

|| NOW AVAILABLE IN LIMITED EDITION OPAL/STERLING & OPAL/14K GOLD ||

> Intentionally rough hewn delicate band is hand formed & polished to a soft golden finish using sustainable, solid brass, the band contains a re-purposed natural coral or turquoise stone placed in a gypsy setting.
- also available in sterling silver


> Try it in a smaller size for a great 1st knuckle standout or wear it true for a classic look


> Made to order. Please state ring size in comments section when ordering. Please anticipate 1-3 weeks shipping time.

- The R O A M / R E M A I N Collection is inspired by past and future travels to far away lands; references are gathered from around the globe. Comprised mainly of fair trade, organic and items found on travels to exotic locals such as India, Mexico, Peru and Greece. This collection signifies a life long love affair with the unknown. With attention to craft and detail, everything is made in beautiful Vancouver, BC. -

____________________________________________________
Copyright: Designs, Photos, Text 2013 JEX, LLC

categories.name: R O A M / R E M A I N

name: A P U S Turquoise Studs
description:
The A P U S Turquoise Studs are part of our
ROAM / REMAIN Collection

> The design of these simple but impactful earrings was originally inspired by antique Tibetan heirlooms found on our travels through Darjeeling & Gangtok, East Sikkim. 
- To the ancient Tibetans turquoise represented the circle of life, this may be attributed to the fact that when turquoise has not been treated, it often changes color

> These earrings, made in brass are set with a delicate 2mm turquoise cabochon. The backing is also made of hypoallergenic, tarnish proof brass. Also included are a pair of comfortable rubber sleeper backings.

> Made to order. Please anticipate 1-3 weeks shipping time.

- The R O A M / R E M A I N Collection is inspired by past and future travels to far away lands; references are gathered from around the globe. Comprised mainly of fair trade, organic and items found on travels to exotic locals such as India, Mexico, Peru and Greece. This collection signifies a life long love affair with the unknown. With attention to craft and detail, everything is made in beautiful Vancouver, BC. -

categories.name: R O A M / R E M A I N

name: P E N D U L U M Necklace
description:
The P E N D U L U M Necklace is part of our 
S T I C K S / S T O N E S Collection 

> One of our best sellers, this minimal & simple piece, is great worn layered or on its own

> Strung on vintage chains made in Toronto circa 1950, a delicate handmade brass tassel hangs from the semi precious stone pendulum of your choice

Choose from - 
> Green Malachite / Black Onyx (Transformation. Protection. Healing)
> Pink Rhodonite / Red Poppy Jasper (Love. Power. Memory)
> Blue Lapis / White Howlite (Protection. Healing. Calm. Strength)
OR
> Green Chrysoprase / Grey Jade (Heart. Clarification. Luck. Money)


> Necklace hangs 16 inches long
> Each piece is made to order, please anticipate 1-3 weeks shipping time

- Reflection upon lucid dreamscapes, tribal, prismatic color, mountains and temples occurs when conceptualizing designs for this collection; with a focus on colorful, graphic and finely detailed elements. Translating into a youthful, tough love aesthetic. -

Each original design begins from a pencil sketch that is carefully translated by hand in our Vancouver studio before being created in metal and semi-precious stones. With attention to craft and detail, everything is made in beautiful Vancouver, BC.
Each and every piece is one-of-a-kind, versatile and timeless.

____________________________________________________ 

Copyright: Designs, Photos, Text @2012 JEX, LLC. Please do not recreate

name: V A J R A RING
description:
The VAJRA Ring is part of our
ROAM / REMAIN Collection

> The design of this ring is inspired by antique beads found on our travels through Northern India. "Vajra" is Sanskrit for diamond, referencing this pieces herkimer diamond shape.

> Hand carved in clay, then cast into metal using the lost wax method. the Vajra is set upon a hand formed sterling silver band, then polished to a high shine finish.

> Made to order. Please anticipate 1-3 weeks shipping time.

S P A C E / T I M E - Inspired by past and future travels to far away lands; references are gathered from around the globe. ROAM / REMAIN Collection

> Inspired by our travels through Northern India, the delicate triangle design of this ring is inspired by traditional mehndi designs witnessed on the hands of women at festivals & celebrations. The triangle or zigzag pattern represents the rainy season, abundance & new life.

> Try it in a smaller size for a great 1st knuckle standout or wear it true for a classic look 


> Delicate peaked band, formed & polished to a rosy golden finish by using sustainable, solid brass

categories.name: R O A M / R E M A I N

name: V E L A Open Stacking Ring
description:
The VELA Ring is part of our
ROAM / REMAIN Collection

> Inspired by our travels through East Sikkim, India; the unique uncontinuous shape of this ring was inspired by the beautiful sharply winding roads leading north between Darjeeling and Gangtok. These roads, lying like a slithering snake amidst undulating tea gardens are often partially hidden by clouds, creating the illusion of leading nowhere. A treat to the eyes.

> Delicate open band, rounded at the ends & brushed to a golden finish by using sustainable, solid brass. 
- also available in sterling silver & 14k gold

> Try it in a smaller size for a wonderful 1st knuckle adornment or wear it true to size and stack it up as an addition to other pieces

> Made to order. Please state ring size in comments section when ordering. Note: this ring is slightly adjustable. Please anticipate 1-3 weeks shipping time.

- Our R O A M / R E M A I N Collection is inspired by past and future travels to far away lands; references are gathered from around the globe. Comprised mainly of fair trade, organic and items found on travels to exotic locals such as India, Mexico, Peru and Greece. This collection signifies a life long love affair with the unknown. With attention to craft and detail, everything is made in beautiful Vancouver, BC. -

____________________________________________________

categories.name: R O A M / R E M A I N

name: Little TOOTH Necklace - Shark trust benefit piece
description:
The Little TOOTH Necklace is from our
F L A U R A / F A U N A Collection

This delicate piece resembling a rose thorn is hand carved and cast from a shark tooth found on the beaches of Oahu

> Smooth bronze tooth with Sterling silver chain from Italy and custom JEX tag
- Tooth also available in Sterling Silver

> Necklace hangs 6" long

> Each piece is made to order, please anticipate 1-3 weeks shipping time

+ + A portion of all sales from this necklace will be donated to The Shark Trust; an organization that benefits the study, management and conservation of sharks, skates and rays. 73 million sharks are killed annually because of the high demand for their fins, causing many shark species to be at risk of extinction. As essential predators, their depletion effects the health of the entire ocean ecosystems. + +

- Taking inspiration from my Aboriginal Canadian heritage and the wonderful decadence found in nature. Traditional dance, spirituality and sacred rituals - this freedom of movement and loose expressive nature paired with a love of texture, wearability and sustainability has really inspired this collection. -

____________________________________________________
Copyright: Designs, Photos, Text @2012 JEX, LLC. Please do not recreate

categories.name: F L A U R A / F A U N A

name: K A R C H E R O S Necklace - Shark Trust Benefit Piece
description:
The K A R C H E R O S Necklace is from our
 F L A U R A / F A U N A Collection

This considerably large piece is hand carved and cast from a 10 million year old prehistoric shark tooth; having collected minerals and fossils since childhood, I stumbled upon this tooth in one of my many collections during a visit home.

> Choose from: 
Textured bronze tooth with oxidized detail & oxidized brass chain
OR
> Smooth bronze tooth with Sterling silver chain from Italy
> 4.5ft of chain is doubled each side. Adding strength and interesting detail
> Necklace hangs 16" long

> Each piece is made to order, please anticipate 1-3 weeks shipping time


+ + A portion of all sales from this necklace will be donated to The Shark Trust; an organization that benefits the study, management and conservation of sharks, skates and rays. 73 million sharks are killed annually because of the high demand for their fins, causing many shark species to be at risk of extinction. As essential predators, their depletion effects the health of the entire ocean ecosystems. + +

- Taking inspiration from my Aboriginal Canadian heritage and the wonderful decadence found in nature. Traditional dance, spirituality and sacred rituals - this freedom of movement and loose expressive nature paired with a love of texture, wearability and sustainability has really inspired this collection. -

____________________________________________________ 
Copyright: Designs, Photos, Text @2012 JEX, LLC. Please do not recreate

name: Q U I L L 2-Way Necklace
description:
The Q U I L L Necklace is part of our 
F L A U R A / F A U N A Collection 

> Utilizing naturally shed porcupine quills (traditionally used in Cree cradleboards & handicrafts), this unique piece can be worn 2 ways, long and lean or to the side for added interest.

>Fine italian sterling silver or 14k gold chain 14.5" long when worn symmetrically & 10.2" long when quills are worn to the side
> 14k gold plated clasp, bead and quill caps

> Each piece is made to order, please anticipate 1-3 weeks shipping time

- Taking inspiration from my Aboriginal Canadian heritage and the wonderful decadence found in nature. Traditional dance, spirituality and sacred rituals - this freedom of movement and loose expressive nature paired with a love of texture, wearability and sustainability has really inspired this collection. -

Each original design begins from a pencil sketch that is carefully translated by hand in our Vancouver studio before being created in metal and organic materials. With attention to craft and detail, everything is made in beautiful Vancouver, BC.
Each and every piece is one-of-a-kind, versatile and timeless.

____________________________________________________
